tool_description: Analyzes time-series data to detect trends, anomalies, and significant changes in social media metrics and brand performance.

time_series_data.description: Array of metric values in chronological order

timestamps.description: Array of timestamps corresponding to each data point

anomaly_threshold.description: Threshold for anomaly detection as standard deviations (1.0-5.0)

seasonality_check.description: Whether to check for seasonal patterns in the data

error_messages: Mismatched array lengths: time_series_data and timestamps must have the same length
Insufficient data points: At least 10 data points required for trend analysis
Trend sensitivity out of range: trend_sensitivity must be between 0.1 and 1.0
Anomaly threshold out of range: anomaly_threshold must be between 1.0 and 5.0
Invalid timestamps: All timestamps must be valid ISO 8601 format and in chronological order
Too many data points: Maximum 10000 data points allowed per analysis
usage: Provide time-series data with corresponding timestamps. Optionally configure trend sensitivity, anomaly threshold, and seasonality checking. Returns trend analysis and detected patterns.

trend_direction.description: Overall trend direction (increasing, decreasing, stable, volatile)

anomaly_indices.description: Array of indices where anomalies were detected

change_points.description: Array of indices where significant changes occurred

seasonal_pattern.description: Whether seasonal patterns were detected in the data

forecast_next_values.description: Array of next 5 forecasted values based on detected trends
